articles.author: Emma Munbodh
articles.title: Man turns fizzy drink idea into £2million business - now it's now sold in Sainsbury's - The Mirror
articles.description: EXCLUSIVE: Soda Folk was created after founder Ken Graham moved to the UK from the US and realised he couldn’t buy his favourite American fizzy drinks in supermarkets in England
articles.content:
A soda drink that went from a simple kitchen idea to being stocked in almost every supermarket is now making £2million in sales a year and it only has two full time employees.

articles.description: Australian Alexei Popyrin has been dealt the toughest assignment in tennis, while world No.1 Ashleigh Barty will play American Bernarda Pera first.

articles.title: Production of another COVID-19 vaccine to begin in weeks - CTV News
articles.description: Production of another potential vaccine against COVID-19 will begin within weeks, its developers Sanofi and GlaxoSmithKline said Thursday as they launched a large trial enrolling 35,000 adult volunteers in the United States, Asia, Africa and Latin America.
